alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 10:35AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, SOUTHEASTERN RIPLEY, DEARBORN, SWITZERLAND, CENTRAL CARROLL, NORTHERN BOONE AND NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 AM EDT... At 1035 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bright to 11 miles north of Madison, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Florence, Norwood, Harrison, North College Hill, Madeira, Cheviot, Villa Hills, Mount Healthy, Dayton, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Rising Sun, Bright, Hidden Valley, Burlington, Oakbrook, Finneytown and Cleves. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 2 and 10. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 164 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky near mile marker 182. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
